decks.notes: The main focus of this deck is to assemble the combo of Lotus Field with various mana ramp, untap, and search effects in order to generate a large amount of mana quickly. The deck uses cards like Sylvan Scrying, Vizier of Tumbling Sands, Hidden Strings, and Bala Ged Recovery to find and untap Lotus Field, allowing for explosive plays. The deck also includes cards like Omniscience and Emergent Ultimatum for additional win conditions or to tutor up key pieces. Overall, the deck aims to create a powerful mana engine to overpower opponents.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly deploy Arclight Phoenixes by casting cheap spells, utilizing cards like Opt, Fiery Impulse, and Lightning Axe to trigger their revival ability. The deck also includes card draw options like Treasure Cruise and Consider to maintain card advantage. Additionally, disruptive spells like Spell Pierce and Ashiok, Dream Render help to disrupt opponents' game plans. The deck aims to be aggressive and proactive, applying pressure through flyers like Arclight Phoenix while also disrupting opponents' strategies.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly ramp up mana using green devotion creatures and lands like Nykthos, Shrine to Nyx, in order to cast powerful green spells like Storm the Festival and Elder Gargaroth early on. This aggressive strategy is supported by cards like Cavalier of Thorns and Kiora, Behemoth Beckoner to maintain pressure on the opponent. The inclusion of cards like Oath of Nissa and Boseiju, Who Endures helps to ensure consistency in drawing key cards and protecting important spells from counter magic.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying artifact creatures and equipment to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays. Ensoul Artifact can turn any artifact into a powerful creature, while cards like Spyglass Siren and Smuggler's Copter provide additional threats and utility. Shrapnel Blast and Torch the Tower offer removal options and reach to finish off opponents. With a focus on speed and power, this deck aims to establish a dominant board presence early on and pressure the opponent into submission.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with fast, aggressive creatures and burn spells to deal quick and consistent damage. By utilizing low-cost creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Ghitu Lavarunner, along with burn spells like Play with Fire and Skewer the Critics, the deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early in the game. With cards like Slickshot Show-Off and Kumano Faces Kakkazan providing additional damage output, the deck seeks to end the game swiftly before the opponent can stabilize. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion adds a unique twist to the deck's strategy.

Mono Black Control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy by using cards like Thoughtseize, Duress, and Liliana of the Veil to strip away their resources. It also includes removal spells like Fatal Push and Go for the Throat to deal with threats on the board. The deck aims to control the game using cards like Aclazotz, Deepest Betrayal, Sheoldred, the Apocalypse, and Reckoner Bankbuster to maintain dominance. The mana base includes utility lands like Castle Locthwain and Field of Ruin to support the strategy. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outpace the opponent through careful resource management.
